name: The Banner Saga: Factions
description: The Banner Saga: Factions is the premiere multiplayer role-playing strategy game on PC and Mac. It brings the feeling of beloved tactical games to a high-definition era with gorgeous hand-animated artwork and a degree of depth unprecedented in the realm of free games. Fight, learn, and lead your clan of vikings to glory!
minimum_requirements: OS:Windows XP Processor:1.6GHz Memory:512 MB RAM
recommended_requirements: Memory:1024 MB RAM Other Requirements:Broadband Internet connection

reviews.review_text: So you put together a team of viking and giant warriors and fight short tactical turnbased fights and tournaments to get renown, wich is used to buy more space for warriors or upgrade your warriors. You get matched against players with the same combined level of fighters, resulting in very even matches. The combat system is identical to the banner saga, with the only exception of some small changes to the abilities of some units.  Though I strongly recommend the game, there are some issues that you should know before playing.  First of all it is a player vs player only game. There is no training mode or single player, if you want that you have to buy The banner Saga (strongly recommended as well).  The second major issue is that the game seems kind of forgotten by the developers, there are memory leak issues that cause lag, and updates are close to nonexistent.   The third issue is that most player quit due to the first two, or the fact that the gameplay changes very little over time, resulting in very few players online at any moment. This of course can cause painfully long periods of waiting for a match. This is also to some extent caused by the matching system, in wich you may be unable to battle anyone at all if you don't have enough warriors to put together teams of different levels (ironically happens predominantly to new players).  With those things out of the way, this is really fun and challenging game for you tactics fans. The turn system is different from many other games and is of extreme tactical importance, and to me the number of classes and restrictions are enough for a large umber of tactics and combos.   Adressing the issues: The first becomes a non-issue after like four fights. The community is great and everyone are excited for new players and will help you get started.  The second issue is bad, but in theory if more people play it the devs should work more to upgrade it. It will also likely get a boost after the release of newly announced TBS2.  The third issue is the hard one. I personally don't think its boring, just as I dont think chess is boring, even if chess hasnt got any upgrades or new skins for decades =). And remember that many quit because there are too few players already. what kind of logic is that? But I won't judge anyone who played the game for a year and a half, waiting for someone to fix the lag and crash issues, and stopped playing when nothing happened.  Try it out though. it's Free! and fun!

This game has sucked up more of my life then any other game of Steam to date and with good reason. Essentially a complex version of chess, this game became my obsession for a good six months. While the servers are not nearly as busy as they were during its hayday, the game is still a superb demonstration of how to develop a rich deep combat turn-based combat system with high replay value. Add to that some of the most beautiful hand drawn artwork I have seen since Monkey Island 3 and you have a winner. For those looking for a better single player, offline experience, I recommend the single player game that was the catalyst for this, The Banner Saga (and hopefully soon) its sequel, The Banner Saga 2.
Unexpectedly well balanced for a turn-based game. The armor mechanic is neat. Community is small and there is no ongoing development, but its free. If you like tactical games you could do worse.

This is free multiplayer-only spin-off to The Banner Saga. A must-play tactical chess-like game set in a viking-influenced setting. You control a band of various sturdy human and varl soldiers, setting up a squad of six and bringing it to a sparring session against your friends or a battle against your enemies using all the strength and abilities your squad is capable of.  Easy to learn, tough to master, impossible to stop playing

I wasn't interested in trying this at first. I got on the kickstarter for the singleplayer game still in development, but this is a very interesting tactical game. Two clever features - health and attack strength being the same and the alternating round-robin turn progression - make this more vicious and tenacious than most other turn based tacticals. The outcome is always decided late and the combatants usually pile high.
Beautiful graphic art and a great twist to modern day chess!

It's a decent take on chess if you can get past the technical issues (it runs horribly and for a 2d turn based combat game it's unacceptable, slow and everything lags, even typing is in slow motion, it crashes frequently about 1 in every 3 matches, and I've experienced the exact problems on 2 separate machines). If/when they clean this up it is definitely worth the download. I would not put any actual money into it though, such as the pay to customize your pieces. This is online dueling only, I do recommend buying the separate single player game when it's on sale. There'd be a much bigger community if this game ran smoothly, but right now it's one of the worst performing games I've ever played, and the community is nice but very small. You'll probably be held back unable to use your upgraded pieces because you won't find a match at the higher tiers. Rated matches use the ELO scoring method and an average match is 15 minutes long, but the game isn't stable enough to move up in ranked matches so I mostly played quick matches (same thing but without the score).

Factions is the multiplayer-only portion of 'The Banner Saga.' It has the same fantastic art style, music, and turn-based combat system as the singleplayer, yet boasts an incredibly simple, yet deceptively deep multiplayer. Figuring out which classes I want to put into my party, what order I want them to go in, and how they will work together can consume hours of thought. In a match, positioning and initiative become huge, as well as knowing when to kill an enemy, and when to leave them barely alive as a useless road block.  A fantastically deep game that is a must try for anyone that enjoys the turn-based strategy genre.

The only good thing I have to say about this game is that it is a true multiplayer banner saga adapatation - gameplay wise.  The online match making is the worst. The game seems completely abandoned by the developers and the community - as evidence just look at the lack of global chat and the last news update the developers made (January 2014... for a pre-order message... WTF). When you start out, it is almost impossible to find a match - literally impossible. You'll get stuck in a cycle where you need a certain level of power to play in ranked or tournaments but since you can't find a quick match there is no way to level up - only PvP is available so quick match is the only way to level up at the start. I have played the game for about 4 hours (90% of the time wasted looking for a quick match) and I have only fought 4 matches - fyi, a single match takes about 10-15 minutes max. This game is literally unplayable... It might say free to play, but logically, due to how impossible it is to level up to a decent power level to even being able to find a match is, it requires you to pay for one of the start packs or something - and even then you aren't even guaranteed to even being able to find a match.  Final Verdict: The game is unplayable. I would say try it out, but you might spend over 30 minutes trying to find a match - making even a demo of the game impossible. Don't forget, the game play is true to the original, but the online implementation is what makes this game unplayable. Finally and most importantly, if the devs have given up... then you shouldn't even consider it. PASS.
